articles.content: Neil Wagner battled through the pain of two broken toes in the first Test against Pakistan, but New Zealand coach Gary Stead says the paceman will miss the second match at Hagley Oval in Christchurch… [+2223 chars]

articles.title: COVID-19 pandemic threatens to rob world number one Ashleigh Barty of place in tennis history books - The West Australian
articles.description: COVID-19 threatens to rob Ashleigh Barty of a place in the tennis history books as the first player to capture four consecutive Newcombe Medals.
articles.content:
COVID-19 threatens to rob Ashleigh Barty of a place in the tennis history books as the first player to capture four consecutive Newcombe Medals.

articles.title: Bulls in rare territory after A-League debut leaves Robinson 'fuming' - The World Game
articles.description: Western Sydney Wanderers coach Carl Robinson was left “fuming inside” after Macarthur FC etched their name in A-League history on Wednesday night.
articles.content:
The Bulls 1-0 victory at Bankwest Stadium saw Australias newest side join both Gold Coast United and Western United as the only expansion clubs to win their opening match since 2007.
